item.title: Cardano Drops Below $1: Will Sellers Target Lower Support Levels?
item.description: Cardano has failed to maintain its position above the critical $1 level, marking a 3.35% decline over the past 24 hours. The altcoin’s seven-day return has now dropped to -8.61%, as broader market weakness pulls the total crypto market cap (excluding Bitcoin and Ethereum) down by 1.62% to $1.05 trillion.

item.title: MMA Fighter ‘Received $151k in Crypto’ Before Moscow Park ‘Terrorist Attack’
item.description:
The MMA fighter Lamberd Akhiadov received cryptoassets and US dollars worth $151,000 before “carrying out a terrorist attack” on December 31, 2022, Russian police say.

item.title: Ledger Co-founder David Balland Freed Following Shock Kidnapping
item.description:
David Balland, co-founder of Ledger, was abducted in France alongside his wife, reportedly for a cryptocurrency ransom. French police rescued him in a dramatic operation and made eight arrests. Balland is receiving medical care as the investigation into the incident continues.

The post Ledger Co-founder David Balland Freed Following Shock Kidnapping appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Trump Signs Executive Order to Develop Regulatory Framework for Digital Assets in US
item.description:
After four days in office, President Trump has signed an executive order banning CBDCs and laying the groundwork for a digital asset regulatory framework. The initiative seeks to position the U.S. as a leader in cryptocurrency innovation while fostering blockchain development.

The post Trump Signs Executive Order to Develop Regulatory Framework for Digital Assets in US appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: OKX Secures MiCA Pre-Authorization to Offer Crypto Services in Europe
item.description:
OKX has secured a pre-authorization under the Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation (MiCA), marking a significant step toward offering regulated crypto services across Europe. Upon receiving the full MiCA license, OKX plans to provide localized cryptocurrency services to over 400 million Europeans through its European Economic Area hub in Malta.

The post OKX Secures MiCA Pre-Authorization to Offer Crypto Services in Europe appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Four new stable kernels
item.description: Greg Kroah-Hartman has released the 6.12.11, 6.6.74, 6.1.127, and 5.15.177 stable kernels. They all contain important fixes, as is the usual case.

item.title: The trouble with the new uretprobes
item.description: A "uretprobe" is a dynamic, user-space tracepoint injected by the kernel into a running process; this document tersely describes their use. Among other things, uretprobes are used by the perf utility to time function calls. The 6.11 kernel saw a significant change to uretprobes that improved their performance, but that change is also creating trouble for some users. The best way to solve the problem is not entirely clear.
